metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: Charleston So Ca  March 10th 1866.  J. B. Heyward Esq  Dear Sir  The surviving members of The 1st Regt S.C. Vols residing in Charleston most of them of Cos J. K & L. have organized themselves into an association, and at a meeting on Monday night last you were unanimously elected an honorary member, and as Secretary I was instructed to inform you of the election, and also of the objects of our association and to invite your Cooperation. The immediate purposes for which we have formed this Association besides the pleasure of occasional reunions of those who have so long been associated and who have suffered and endured so much together are   1st To Assist as far as we are able such of our comrades as are still suffering from wounds and languishing under disease contracted in the service, and to help those out of employment to obtain it.   2d to collect at once the material to resupply our lost records and to preserve the history of our Regiment.   Having notified you of your election I have only further to ask your cooperation in the purposes of our organization, and to invite your attendance at our future meetings. which take place in the evening of the 12th of each month  I am Very Respectfully  Your Obt. Servt.  A. J. Samson  Secretary
